newsitem.title: USA: Oracle sees Europe rebounding in Q3.
newsitem.headline: Oracle sees Europe rebounding in Q3.

text.p: Oracle Corp Chief Financial Officer Jeff Henley said that so far the company's third quarter "looks good" and that "Europe will show rebound off a really tough quarter."

"I really don't have any different view than I did on the conference call," Henley told a Goldman Sachs conference. On the conference call to discuss the company's second quarter earnings, Oracle executives were optimistic about sequential growth going forward.
In the second quarter ended November 30, 1996, Oracle saw slower growth in Europe, but Henley said that the region's results are rebounding in the current fiscal third quarter.
Henley declined to give any further financial details.
In last year's third quarter ended February 1996, Oracle reported sales of $1.02 billion and profits of $0.33 a share.
